TEXT: The applicant , born in DATE , presently resides in GPE , GPE . In his application form , he states that he has NORP nationality .

On DATE the applicant arrived in GPE and requested asylum . He stated that he was a citizen of GPE . Before leaving for GPE , he had been living in GPE . In DATE the village was attacked by the NORP army . Soldiers searched his family 's home on QUANTITY occasions and took their money and valuables . They also threatened to kill the family members unless they left their home . As a consequence , the applicant decided to leave GPE . The applicant held also a NORP passport but maintained that he could not be considered as a citizen of GPE , as the passport did not entitle him to any civic rights in that country . Allegedly , if sent to GPE , he would be expelled to GPE . Thus , he was very much afraid of being sent to GPE .

On DATE ORG ( ORG invandrarverk ) rejected the applicant 's request and ordered his deportation to GPE . ORG found that the applicant held both NORP and NORP citizenship . Due to the prevailing situation in GPE , he could not be deported to that country . Consequently , in assessing his application , the question was whether he could be afforded protection in GPE . ORG noted that , according to available information , persons in the applicant 's situation did not risk to be sent from GPE to GPE against their will . Further , there was no reason to assume that GPE would not afford the applicant the same protection as other NORP citizens . Finally , the general situation in GPE did not constitute a ground for granting him asylum .
The applicant appealed to ORG ( Utlänningsnämnden ) . He claimed that he had deserted from the NORP army and that , if deported to GPE , he could be forced to serve in that army in GPE .
On DATE ORG rejected the appeal . It shared the opinion of ORG and added that there was no apparent risk that NORP citizens would be forced to take part in armed conflict .

The applicant later requested a temporary residence permit in GPE . By a decision of DATE ORG granted the applicant such a permit until DATE and quashed the deportation order . In so doing , ORG referred to a Government decision of CARDINAL DATE according to which the worsened situation in GPE constituted an impediment to the deportation of asylum seekers to that country .

On DATE the applicant submitted a new application for a residence permit . He referred to his previous statements . Further , at an oral hearing on DATE he claimed that he would not be allowed to stay in GPE and that he could not return to his Muslimdominated home district in GPE .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's new application and ordered his deportation to GPE . Having regard to guiding decisions taken by ORG , the ORG found that the applicant could not be sent back to ORG . With regard to the possible deportation to GPE , the ORG noted that no circumstances had been invoked by the applicant which could lead to the conclusion that he was unable to go to GPE . Consequently , the ORG reiterated the conclusions drawn in the previous decisions taken concerning the applicant .

The applicant appealed to ORG . In addition to what he had previously stated , he referred to the time he had spent in GPE . Having adjusted to NORP society , he claimed that he should be given a residence permit for humanitarian reasons . On DATE ORG upheld ORG decision .

Later , the applicant submitted another application to ORG . He invoked a medical certificate of DATE according to which he suffered from a post - traumatic stress syndrome and had regular contacts with a psychiatric clinic in GPE . Allegedly , he would not get the appropriate treatment for his mental problems in GPE . On DATE ORG rejected the new application .

In DATE the applicant made yet another application for a residence permit . He invoked a further medical certificate concerning his mental health . By decisions of CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE ORG refused to suspend the enforcement of the deportation order and on DATE it rejected the application .

In medical certificates issued by the psychiatric clinic at the hospital in GPE on DATE and DATE chief physician PERSON and therapist PERSON stated that the applicant had undergone treatment for some time at the clinic for a post - traumatic stress syndrome . Allegedly , the enforcement of the deportation order would seriously impair his mental state and could lead to a suicide attempt . The clinic submitted the first certificate to ORG and requested that the enforcement be suspended .
By a decision of DATE ORG suspended the enforcement of the deportation order for an unspecified period of time .
